member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DrawThemeBackground(Vanara.PInvoke.HTHEME,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,System.Int32,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,Vanara.PInvoke.PRECT)
member.summary: Draws the border and fill defined by the visual style for the specified control part.

param.name: hTheme
param.para: Handle to a window's specified theme data. Use OpenThemeData to create an HTHEME.

param.name: hdc
param.para: HDC used for drawing the theme-defined background image.

param.name: iPartId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the part to draw. See Parts and States.

param.name: iStateId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the state of the part to draw. See Parts and States.

param.name: pRect
param.para: Pointer to a RECT structure that contains the rectangle, in logical coordinates, in which the background image is drawn.

param.name: pClipRect
param.para: Pointer to a RECT structure that contains a clipping rectangle. This parameter may be set to NULL.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: [ DrawThemeBackgroundEx is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Draws the background image defined by the visual style for the specified control part.

param.name: hTheme
param.para: Handle to a window's specified theme data. Use OpenThemeData to create an HTHEME.

param.name: hdc
param.para: HDC used for drawing the theme-defined background image.

param.name: iPartId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the part to draw. See Parts and States.

param.name: iStateId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the state of the part to draw. See Parts and States.

param.name: pRect
param.para: Pointer to a RECT structure that contains the rectangle, in logical coordinates, in which the background image is drawn.

param.name: pOptions
param.para: Pointer to a DTBGOPTS structure that contains clipping information. This parameter may be set to NULL.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DrawThemeEdge(Vanara.PInvoke.HTHEME,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,System.Int32,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,Vanara.PInvoke.User32.BorderStyles3D,Vanara.PInvoke.User32.BorderFlags,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@)
member.summary: Draws one or more edges defined by the visual style of a rectangle.

param.name: hTheme
param.para: Handle to a window's specified theme data. Use OpenThemeData to create an HTHEME.

param.name: iPartId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the part that contains the rectangle. See Parts and States.

param.name: iStateId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the state of the part. See Parts and States.

param.name: pDestRect
param.para: Pointer to a RECT structure that contains, in logical coordinates, the rectangle.

param.name: uEdge
param.para: UINT that specifies the type of inner and outer edges to draw. This parameter must be a combination of one inner-border flag and one outer-border flag, or one of the combination flags. The border flags are:

param.name: uFlags
param.para: UINT that specifies the type of border to draw. This parameter can be a combination of the following values.

item.term: The rectangle pointed to by the pDestRect parameter is shrunk to exclude the edges that were drawn; otherwise the rectangle does not change.
Bottom and left side of border rectangle.
Bottom and right side of border rectangle.
Diagonal border. The end point is the lower-left corner of the rectangle; the origin is the upper-right corner.
Diagonal border. The end point is the lower-right corner of the rectangle; the origin is the upper-left corner.
Diagonal border. The end point is the upper-left corner of the rectangle; the origin is the lower-right corner.
Diagonal border. The end point is the upper-right corner of the rectangle; the origin is the lower-left corner.
Interior of the rectangle is to be filled.
Top and left side of border rectangle.
Top and right side of border rectangle.

param.name: pContentRect
param.para: Pointer to a RECT structure that contains, in logical coordinates, the rectangle that receives the interior rectangle, if uFlags is set to BF_ADJUST. This parameter may be set to NULL.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DrawThemeParentBackground(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,Vanara.PInvoke.PRECT)
member.summary: Draws the part of a parent control that is covered by a partially-transparent or alpha-blended child control.

param.name: prc
param.para: The area to be drawn. The rectangle is in the child window's coordinates. If this parameter is NULL, the area to be drawn includes the entire area occupied by the child control.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DrawThemeParentBackgroundEx(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DrawThemeParentBackgroundFlags,Vanara.PInvoke.PRECT)
member.summary: Used by partially-transparent or alpha-blended child controls to draw the part of their parent in front of which they appear. Sends a WM_ERASEBKGND message followed by a WM_PRINTCLIENT.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Zero or more of the following values. If this value is zero, this function returns S_OK only if the parent handled WM_PRINTCLIENT.

item.term: If set, hdc is assumed to be a window DC, not a client DC.
If set, this function sends a WM_CTLCOLORSTATIC message to the parent and uses the brush if one is provided. Otherwise, it uses COLOR_BTNFACE.
If set, this function returns S_OK without sending a WM_CTLCOLORSTATIC message if the parent actually painted on WM_ERASEBKGND.

param.name: prc
param.para: Optional. The area to be drawn, in child coordinates. If this parameter is NULL, the area to be drawn includes the entire area occupied by the child control.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DrawThemeText(Vanara.PInvoke.HTHEME,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@)
member.summary: Draws text using the color and font defined by the visual style.

param.name: hTheme
param.para: Handle to a window's theme data. Use OpenThemeData to create an HTHEME.

param.name: iPartId
param.para: The control part that has the desired text appearance. See Parts and States. If this value is 0, the text is drawn in the default font, or a font selected into the device context.

param.name: iStateId
param.para: The control state that has the desired text appearance. See Parts and States.

param.name: pszText
param.para: Pointer to a string that contains the text to draw.

param.name: iCharCount
param.para: Value of type int that contains the number of characters to draw. If the parameter is set to -1, all the characters in the string are drawn.

param.name: dwTextFlags
param.para: DWORD that contains one or more values that specify the string's formatting. See Format Values for possible parameter values.

param.name: pRect
param.para: Pointer to a RECT structure that contains the rectangle, in logical coordinates, in which the text is to be drawn. It is recommended to use pExtentRect from GetThemeTextExtent to retrieve the correct coordinates.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DrawThemeTextEx(Vanara.PInvoke.HTHEME,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.DrawTextFlags,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DTTOPTS@)
member.summary: Draws text using the color and font defined by the visual style. Extends DrawThemeText by allowing additional text format options.

param.name: hTheme
param.para: Handle to a window's specified theme data. Use OpenThemeData to create an HTHEME.

param.name: iPartId
param.para: The control part that has the desired text appearance. See Parts and States. If this value is 0, the text is drawn in the default font, or a font selected into the device context.

param.name: iStateId
param.para: The control state that has the desired text appearance. See Parts and States.

param.name: pszText
param.para: Pointer to a string that contains the text to draw.

param.name: iCharCount
param.para: Value of type int that contains the number of characters to draw. If the parameter is set to -1, all the characters in the string are drawn.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: DWORD that contains one or more values that specify the string's formatting. See Format Values for possible parameter values.

param.name: pRect
param.para: Pointer to a RECT structure that contains the rectangle, in logical coordinates, in which the text is to be drawn.

param.name: pOptions
param.para: A DTTOPTS structure that defines additional formatting options that will be applied to the text being drawn.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.EnableThemeDialogTexture(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.ThemeDialogTextureFlags)
member.summary: Enables or disables the visual style of the background of a dialog window.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Window handle of the target dialog box.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: One of the following option flag values:

item.term: Enables dialog window background texturing. The texturing is defined by a visual style.
Uses the Tab control texture for the background texture of a dialog window.
Uses the Aero wizard texture for the background texture of a dialog window.
Enables dialog window background texturing. The texture is the Tab control texture defined by the visual style. This flag is equivalent to (ETDT_ENABLE | ETDT_USETABTEXTURE).

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Windows Vista through Windows 7: Enables or disables visual styles for the current user in the current and later sessions.
Windows 8 and later: This function does nothing. Visual styles are always enabled in Windows 8 and later.

param.name: fEnable
param.para: Receives one of the following values.

item.term: Enables visual styles. If the user previously had an active visual style, it becomes active again.
Disables visual styles and turns visual styles off.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.GetThemeBool(Vanara.PInvoke.HTHEME,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of a BOOL property from the SysMetrics section of theme data.

param.name: hTheme
param.para: Handle to a window's specified theme data. Use OpenThemeData to create an HTHEME.

param.name: iPartId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the part containing the BOOL property. See Parts and States.

param.name: iStateId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the state of the part. See Parts and States.

param.name: iPropId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the property to retrieve. May be one of the following values.

item.term: TRUE if the image associated with the part and state have transparent areas. See GetThemeColor for the definition of the TMT_TRANSPARENTCOLOR value that defines the transparent color.
TRUE if the nonclient caption area associated with the part and state vary with text width.
TRUE if the image associated with the part and state should only have its border drawn.
TRUE if the control associated with the part and state will handle its own compositing of images.
TRUE if true-sized images associated with this part and state are to be drawn on the background fill.
TRUE if the glyph associated with this part and state have transparent areas. See GetThemeColor for the definition of the TMT_GLYPHCOLOR value that defines the transparent color.
TRUE if the glyph associated with this part and state should be drawn without a background.
TRUE if the sizing bar associated with this part and state should always be shown.
TRUE if the image associated with this part and state should be flipped if the window is being viewed in right-to-left reading mode.
TRUE if the image associated with this part and state must have equal height and width.
TRUE if the truesize image or border associated with this part and state must be sized to a factor of 2.
TRUE if the image associated with this part and state will scale larger in size if necessary.
TRUE if the image associated with this part and state will scale smaller in size if necessary.
TRUE if the image associated with this part and state is based on the current user.

param.name: pfVal
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that receives the retrieved property value.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Retrieves the value of a metric property.

param.name: iPartId

item.term: The alpha value (0-255) used for DrawThemeIcon.
The minimum alpha value (0-255) that a pixel must be to be considered opaque.
The thickness of the border drawn if this part uses a border fill.
The character index into the selected font that will be used for the glyph, if the part uses a font-based glyph.

The amount of the first gradient color to use in drawing the part. This value can be from 0 to 255, but this value plus the values of each of the GRADIENTRATIO values must add up to 255. See the TMT_GRADIENTCOLOR1 value of GetThemeColor.
The amount of the second gradient color to use in drawing the part.
The amount of the third gradient color to use in drawing the part.
The amount of the fourth gradient color to use in drawing the part.
The amount of the fifth gradient color to use in drawing the part.
The number of state images present in an image file.
The minimum dpi that the first image file was designed for. See GetThemeFilename.
The minimum dpi that the second image file was designed for.
The minimum dpi that the third image file was designed for.
The minimum dpi that the fourth image file was designed for.
The minimum dpi that the fifth image file was designed for.
The size of the progress control "chunk" shapes that define how far an operation has progressed.
The total size of all of the progress control "chunks".
The roundness (0-100%) of the part's corners.
The roundness (0-100%) of the part's corners.
The amount of saturation (0-255) to apply to an icon drawn using DrawThemeIcon.
The thickness of the border drawn around text characters.
The percentage of a true-size image's original size at which the image will be stretched.

param.name: piVal
param.para: Pointer to an int that receives the metric property value.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Retrieves a hit test code for a point in the background specified by a visual style.

param.para: Value of type int that specifies the part. See Parts and States.

param.name: iStateId
param.para: Value of type int that specifies the state of the part. See Parts and States.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DTTOPTS
member.summary: Defines the options for the function.
Defines the options for the DrawThemeTextEx function.

summary.para: Type: DWORD
Size of the structure.
Type: DWORD
A combination of flags that specify whether certain values of the DTTOPTS structure have been specified, and how to interpret these values. This member can be a combination of the following.

item.term: The crText member value is valid.
The crBorder member value is valid.
The crShadow member value is valid.
The iTextShadowType member value is valid.
The ptShadowOffset member value is valid.
The iBorderSize member value is valid.
The iFontPropId member value is valid.
The iColorPropId member value is valid.
The iStateId member value is valid.

The pRect parameter of the DrawThemeTextEx function that uses this structure will be used as both an in and an out parameter. After the function returns, the pRect parameter will contain the rectangle that corresponds to the region calculated to be drawn.
The fApplyOverlay member value is valid.
The iGlowSize member value is valid.
The pfnDrawTextCallback member value is valid.

Draws text with antialiased alpha. Use of this flag requires a top-down DIB section. This flag works only if the HDC passed to function DrawThemeTextEx has a top-down DIB section currently selected in it. For more information, see Device-Independent Bitmaps.

DTT_TEXTCOLOR | DTT_BORDERCOLOR | DTT_SHADOWCOLOR | DTT_SHADOWTYPE | DTT_SHADOWOFFSET | DTT_BORDERSIZE | DTT_FONTPROP | DTT_COLORPROP | DTT_STATEID | DTT_CALCRECT | DTT_APPLYOVERLAY | DTT_GLOWSIZE | DTT_COMPOSITED.

summary.para: Type: COLORREF
Specifies the color of the text that will be drawn.
Type: COLORREF
Specifies the color of the outline that will be drawn around the text.
Type: COLORREF
Specifies the color of the shadow that will be drawn behind the text.
Type: int
Specifies the type of the shadow that will be drawn behind the text. This member can have one of the following values.

item.term: The shadow will be drawn to appear detailed underneath text.
The shadow will be drawn to appear blurred underneath text.

summary.para: Type: POINT
Specifies the amount of offset, in logical coordinates, between the shadow and the text.
Type: int
Specifies the radius of the outline that will be drawn around the text.
Type: int
Specifies an alternate font property to use when drawing text. For a list of possible values, see GetThemeSysFont.
Type: int

Specifies an alternate color property to use when drawing text. If this value is valid and the corresponding flag is set in dwFlags, this value will override the value of crText. See the values listed in GetSysColor for the nIndex parameter.
Type: int
Specifies an alternate state to use. This member is not used by DrawThemeTextEx.
Type: BOOL
If TRUE, text will be drawn on top of the shadow and outline effects. If FALSE, just the shadow and outline effects will be drawn.
Type: int
Specifies the size of a glow that will be drawn on the background prior to any text being drawn.
Type: DTT_CALLBACK_PROC
Pointer to callback function for DrawThemeTextEx.
Type: LPARAM
Parameter for callback back function specified by pfnDrawTextCallback.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.DTBGOPTS
member.summary: Defines the options for the DrawThemeBackgroundEx function.

summary.para: Type: DWORD
Size of the structure. Set this to sizeof(DTBGOPTS).
Type: DWORD
Flags that specify the selected options. This member can be one of the following:

item.term: rcClip specifies the rectangle to which drawing is clipped.
Deprecated. Draw transparent and alpha images as solid.
Do not draw the border of the part (currently this value is only supported for bgtype=borderfill).
Do not draw the content area of the part (currently this value is only supported for bgtype=borderfill).
Assume the hdc is mirrored and flip images as appropriate (currently this value is only supported for bgtype=imagefile).
Do not mirror the output; even in right-to-left (RTL) layout.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BeginBufferedAnimation(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BP_BUFFERFORMAT,Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BP_PAINTPARAMS,Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BP_ANIMATIONPARAMS@,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC@,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC@)
member.summary: Begins a buffered animation operation. The animation consists of a cross-fade between the contents of two buffers over a specified period of time.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: A handle to the window in which the animations play.

param.name: hdcTarget
param.para: A handle of the target DC on which the buffer is animated.

param.name: rcTarget
param.para: A pointer to a structure that specifies the area of the target DC in which to draw.

param.name: pPaintParams
param.para: A pointer to a structure that defines the paint operation parameters. This value can be NULL.

param.name: pAnimationParams
param.para: A pointer to a structure that defines the animation operation parameters.

param.name: phdcFrom
param.para: When this function returns, this value points to the handle of the DC where the application should paint the initial state of the animation, if not NULL.

param.name: phdcTo
param.para: When this function returns, this value points to the handle of the DC where the application should paint the final state of the animation, if not NULL.

returns.para: A handle to the buffered paint animation.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BeginBufferedPaint(Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BP_BUFFERFORMAT,Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BP_PAINTPARAMS,Vanara.PInvoke.HDC@)
member.summary: Begins a buffered paint operation.

param.name: hdcTarget
param.para: The handle of the target DC on which the buffer will be painted.

param.name: prcTarget
param.para: A pointer to a RECT structure that specifies the area of the target DC in which to paint.

param.name: dwFormat
param.para: A member of the BP_BUFFERFORMAT enumeration that specifies the format of the buffer.

param.name: pPaintParams
param.para: A pointer to a BP_PAINTPARAMS structure that defines the paint operation parameters. This value can be NULL.

param.name: phdc
param.para: When this function returns, points to the handle of the new device context.

returns.para: A handle to the buffered paint context. If this function fails, the return value is NULL, and phdc is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
The returned handle is freed when EndBufferedPaint is called.

An application should call BufferedPaintInit on the calling thread before calling BeginBufferedPaint, and BufferedPaintUnInit before the thread is terminated. Failure to call BufferedPaintInit may result in degraded performance due to internal data being initialized and destroyed for each buffered paint operation.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BufferedPaintClear(Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.HPAINTBUFFER,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@)
member.summary: Clears a specified rectangle in the buffer to ARGB = {0,0,0,0}.

param.name: hBufferedPaint
param.para: The handle of the buffered paint context, obtained through BeginBufferedPaint.

param.name: prc
param.para: A pointer to a RECT structure that specifies the rectangle to clear. Set this parameter to NULL to specify the entire buffer.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BufferedPaintInit
member.summary: Initialize buffered painting for the current thread.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Paints the next frame of a buffered paint animation.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle to the window in which the animations play.

param.name: hdcTarget
param.para: Handle of the target DC on which the buffer is animated.

returns.para: Returns TRUE if the frame has been painted, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BufferedPaintSetAlpha(Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.HPAINTBUFFER,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the alpha to a specified value in a given rectangle. The alpha controls the amount of transparency applied when blending with the buffer onto the destination target device context (DC).

param.name: hBufferedPaint
param.para: The handle of the buffered paint context, obtained through BeginBufferedPaint.

param.name: prc
param.para: A pointer to a RECT structure that specifies the rectangle in which to set the alpha. Set this parameter to NULL to specify the entire buffer.

param.name: alpha
param.para: The alpha value to set. The alpha value can range from zero (fully transparent) to 255 (fully opaque).

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BufferedPaintStopAllAnimations(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND)
member.summary: Stops all buffered animations for the given window.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: The handle of the window in which to stop all animations.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.BufferedPaintUnInit
member.summary: Closes down buffered painting for the current thread. Called once for each call to BufferedPaintInit after calls to BeginBufferedPaint are no longer needed.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.EndBufferedAnimation(Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.HANIMATIONBUFFER,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renders the first frame of a buffered animation operation and starts the animation timer.

param.name: hbpAnimation
param.para: The handle to the buffered animation context that was returned by BeginBufferedAnimation.

param.name: fUpdateTarget
param.para: If TRUE, updates the target DC with the animation. If FALSE, the animation is not started, the target DC is not updated, and the hbpAnimation parameter is freed.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.EndBufferedPaint(Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.HPAINTBUFFER,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Completes a buffered paint operation and frees the associated buffered paint handle.

param.name: hBufferedPaint
param.para: The handle of the buffered paint context, obtained through BeginBufferedPaint.

param.name: fUpdateTarget
param.para: TRUE to copy the buffer to the target DC.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.GetBufferedPaintBits(Vanara.PInvoke.UxTheme.HPAINTBUFFER,System.IntPtr@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the buffer bitmap if the buffer is a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

param.name: hBufferedPaint
param.para: The handle of the buffered paint context, obtained through BeginBufferedPaint.

param.name: ppbBuffer
param.para: When this function returns, contains a pointer to the address of the buffer bitmap pixels.

param.name: pcxRow
param.para: When this function returns, contains a pointer to the width, in pixels, of the buffer bitmap. This value is not necessarily equal to the buffer width. It may be larger.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise. If an error occurs, ppbBuffer is set to NULL and pcxRow is set to zero.
